mim.author: ETXJOTJ
mim.name: RcsSysM
mim.description: This fragment defines the features used by other fragments or by the managed element itself. These include the schema for the managed element that will define the version handling for the model parts and the handling of the NTP server information.

enum.name: BasicAdmState
enum.description: Basic administrative states for a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

derivedDataType.name: IpDNSAddress
derivedDataType.description: The IpDNSAddress type represents an IP address or a DNS domain name. A version 4 IP address is specified in dotted quad notation, for example 130.100.92.154. RFC 791 describes the syntax in detail. A version 6 IP address is specified by 8 groups of 16 bit hexadecimal values separated by colons, for example, 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334. RFC 4291 describes the syntax in detail. A DNS name is specified as a fully qualified domain name, for example, myhost.ericsson.com. The internet domain is loosely specified but RFC 1034 recommends a syntax.

class.name: SysM
class.description:
This is the System Management MO.
It is a parent to the MOs which represent the system level functions such as time handling and version handling as well as file transfer capabilities and netconf configuration.

attribute.name: sysMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

class.name: NtpServer
class.description:
The NTP server configuration data.
This MOC presents a persistent NTP client mode network association with a specified remote server or local reference clock address.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

attribute.name: ntpServerId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

attribute.name: serverAddress
attribute.description:
The address of the NTP server with which a persistent client server mode association will be made.
The serverAddress represents either a V4 or a V6 IP address or a DNS domain name.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
Locks or unlocks the operation of the NTP client function.
This is a convenience function to permit some or all NtpServer instances to be temporarily locked without having to delete the object.

class.name: Schema
class.description: Represents a MIM model fragment whose corresponding functionality is operational in the ME.

action.name: export
action.description:
Pushes the schema file out from the ME.
The URI shall contain both the file name and the destination address. The password is optional.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description:
The URI for file transfer.
The URI used for identifying the adress to the remote location to which the file shall be transferred to.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password used for connecting to the remote file location.

attribute.name: schemaId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

attribute.name: identifier
attribute.description: Represents the name of the data model fragment that the schema represents.

attribute.name: baseModelIdentifier
attribute.description: Represents the name of the common information model fragment that the data model fragment is derived from.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Represents the full version information for the data model fragment that the schema represents.

attribute.name: baseModelVersion
attribute.description: The full version information for the common information model fragment that the data model fragment is derived from.

attribute.name: selectedModelOptions
attribute.description:
Contains the model features used in the generation of the MIM.
The MS can query the information from the model without having to access the MIM file itself.

class.name: NetconfTls
class.description: Represents the Netconf configuration management service over Transport Layer Security (TLS).

attribute.name: netconfTlsId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

attribute.name: nodeCredential
attribute.description: The credential used for the NETCONF service. Specifies the DN of a NodeCredential MO in Certificate Management.

attribute.name: trustCategory
attribute.description: The set of certificates trusted by the NETCONF service. Specifies the DN of a TrustCategory MO in Certificate Management.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state for the Netconf target. When LOCKED all on-going netconf connections will immediately be terminated.
NOTE: Setting the administrativState to LOCKED for all Netconf and CLI interfaces disables O&M access to the ME. Refer to product specific troubleshooting instructions to resolve such a scenario.

attribute.name: port
attribute.description: The OaM port.

class.name: NetconfSsh
class.description: Represents the Netconf configuration management service over Secure Shell.

attribute.name: netconfSshId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state for the Netconf target. When LOCKED all on-going netconf connections will immediately be terminated.
NOTE: Setting the administrativState to LOCKED for all Netconf and CLI interfaces disables O&M access to the ME. Refer to product specific troubleshooting instructions to resolve such a scenario.

attribute.name: port
attribute.description: The OaM port.

class.name: CliSsh
class.description: Represents the CLI configuration management service over Secure Shell.

attribute.name: cliSshId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state for the CLI target. When LOCKED all on-going CLI connections will immediately be terminated.
NOTE: Setting the administrativState to LOCKED for all Netconf and CLI interfaces disables O&M access to the ME. Refer to product specific troubleshooting instructions to resolve such a scenario.

attribute.name: port
attribute.description: The OaM port.

class.name: CliTls
class.description: Represents the CLI configuration management service over Transport Layer Security (TLS).

attribute.name: cliTlsId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

attribute.name: nodeCredential
attribute.description: The credential used for the CLI service. Specifies the DN of a NodeCredential MO in Certificate Management.

attribute.name: trustCategory
attribute.description: The set of certificates trusted by the CLI service. Specifies the DN of a TrustCategory MO in Certificate Management.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state for the CLI target. When LOCKED all on-going netconf connections will immediately be terminated.
NOTE: Setting the administrativState to LOCKED for all Netconf and CLI interfaces disables O&M access to the ME. Refer to product specific troubleshooting instructions to resolve such a scenario.

attribute.name: port
attribute.description: The OaM port.

class.name: OamAccessPoint
class.description: An OaM Access Point instance for the ME.

attribute.name: oamAccessPointId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

attribute.name: accessPoint
attribute.description: The OaM access point. Refers to an IP interface MO which contains either an IPv4 or IPv6 address.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description:
The Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value for OAM services. Only IP packets originated form the node are tagged with the DSCP value.
The DSCP value is used by Differentiated Services enabled hosts and routers to identify different service levels. When set, the DSCP value is mapped to a Per-Hop Behaviour (PHB) by forwarding devices along the path between the source and destination. A PHB dictates how each package is handled, that is, what type of service that is applied to the packet when it is forwarded.
attribute.statusInformation: Deprecated since 16A. Use attribute OamTrafficClass::dscp instead

attribute.name: ipv4address
attribute.description: Refers to the IPv4 interface MO to which the OAM services shall bind.
attribute.statusInformation: Deprecated since 16A. Use attribute accessPoint instead.

attribute.name: netconfPort
attribute.description: Port for accessing the NETCONF service
attribute.statusInformation: Deprecated since16A. Use attribute NetconfSsh::port instead

attribute.name: sshPort
attribute.description: Port for accessing the Ericsson Command Line interface service
attribute.statusInformation: Deprecated since 16A. Use attribute CliSsh::port instead.

class.name: OamTrafficClass
class.description: Defines the traffic class and priority for IP packets.

attribute.name: oamTrafficClassId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the traffic class associated with this DSCP class.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description:
The Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value for OAM services related IP packets. Only IP packets originated from the node are tagged with the DSCP value.
The DSCP value is used by Differentiated Services enabled hosts and routers to identify different service levels. When set, the DSCP value is mapped to a Per-Hop Behaviour (PHB) by forwarding devices along the path between the source and destination. A PHB dictates how each package is handled, i.e. what type of service that is applied to the packet when it is forwarded.
